p: The field emission scanning electron microscopy images (FESEM) of tea waste char and sulfonated tea waste catalyst are illustrated in Figure 2. It was found that the FESEM image of sulfonated tea waste char was rough, amorphous and had a heterogeneous structure, whereas the sulfonated tea waste char catalyst which was initially treated with phosphoric acid showed a very clear porous structure on the char surface. Konwar et al. [31] observed that the pretreatment of carbon catalyst with phosphoric acid has led to a porous carbon structure with high surface area associated with highly active sites and these findings agree well with our results.
